title: Vietnamese Pho
excerpt: Discover the richness of Pho, a traditional Vietnamese soup known for its fragrant broth and hearty ingredients. A classic dish beloved by many, Pho combines rice noodles with various herbs, spices, and usually beef or chicken, creating a symphony of flavors in every bowl.
steps: Char onion and ginger until blackened.
Boil beef bones in water and skim off impurities.
Add charred onion and ginger along with spices.
Cook beef brisket in broth, then slice thinly.
Prepare rice noodles as per package instructions.
Assemble bowls with noodles, broth, beef, and toppings.
Serve hot with fresh herbs and sauces.

title: Banh Mi
excerpt: Explore the world of Banh Mi, the classic Vietnamese sandwich that harmoniously blends East and West. This culinary delight features a crispy baguette filled with a variety of ingredients, such as savory meats, pickled vegetables, fresh herbs, and spicy condiments, making it a perfect choice for any time of the day.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons pickled carrots and daikon radish
steps: Slice the baguette lengthwise but do not cut all the way through, leaving one edge intact.
Spread liver pâté on one side of the baguette.
Layer the thinly sliced pork on top of the pâté.
Add cucumber slices and pickled carrots and daikon radish.
Drizzle with soy sauce and fish sauce.
Add fresh cilantro leaves and sliced chili if desired.
Optionally, spread mayonnaise on the other side of the baguette.
Close the sandwich and press lightly.
Serve immediately or wrap in parchment paper for a to-go meal.
